column4: Am I the only one that has issues with shutdowns involving smbfs ? As a matter of fact, my Pcs take minutes to shutdown instead of seconds, and they seem to hang on the samba folders unmounting.
Does someone know how to properly unmount smbfs folders at shutdown ?
: yes samba is the service managing the shared folders. But my problem is within the client, not the server (as far as I know)
: At shutdown, the system hangs for several minutes. The logs are showing it's waiting for the smb shares to unmount. Manually they can be unmounted without any problem.
I have never seen that. I dont think its normal
I don't thing either, but it happens on at least two of my 10.04 boxes
try #samba, and if you find out, let me know
can you try to do the same, just to see whether it's a general issue or specific to me ?
unfortunately, with different hardware and whomever installed it, it can be many problems
It happens on very different machines here. One has only to setup a smbfs mount in fstab, and see if it slows the shutdown
oh, I see. smbfs. a file system. I use ext3/4
I dont think Ive ever used or seen smbfs
it's very handy for managing samba shares that have to be automatically mounted
I use smb.conf - not as handy, I bet
this is from the samba.org website: "smbfs has not been maintained in the last few years. Instead, development has been focused on another implementation of the CIFS protocol in the kernel. "
actually, it's cifs that is declared in fstab, not smbfs
